content.json:
<style>
/* DefenderC2 Retro Terminal Theme - Matrix/Green Phosphor CRT Style */
.workbook-content {
    background-color: #000000 !important;
    font-family: 'Courier New', 'Consolas', monospace !important;
    color: #00ff00 !important;
}

/* Headers and titles */
.workbook-content h1, 
.workbook-content h2, 
.workbook-content h3 {
    color: #00ff00 !important;
    text-shadow: 0 0 10px #00ff00, 0 0 20px #00ff00;
    border-bottom: 2px solid #00ff00 !important;
    font-family: 'Courier New', monospace !important;
}

/* Parameter panels and inputs */
.workbook-content .parameter-container {
    background-color: #001100 !important;
    border: 1px solid #00ff00 !important;
    padding: 10px !important;
}

.workbook-content input, 
.workbook-content select, 
.workbook-content textarea {
    background-color: #000000 !important;
    color: #00ff00 !important;
    border: 1px solid #00ff00 !important;
    font-family: 'Courier New', monospace !important;
}

/* Tables */
.workbook-content table {
    background-color: #000000 !important;
    border: 1px solid #00ff00 !important;
}

.workbook-content th {
    background-color: #001a00 !important;
    color: #00ff00 !important;
    border: 1px solid #00ff00 !important;
    text-shadow: 0 0 5px #00ff00;
}

.workbook-content td {
    background-color: #000000 !important;
    color: #00ff00 !important;
    border: 1px solid #003300 !important;
}

.workbook-content tr:hover td {
    background-color: #001100 !important;
}

/* Buttons and links */
.workbook-content button, 
.workbook-content .link-item {
    background-color: #001100 !important;
    color: #00ff00 !important;
    border: 2px solid #00ff00 !important;
    text-shadow: 0 0 5px #00ff00;
    font-family: 'Courier New', monospace !important;
    padding: 8px 16px !important;
    transition: all 0.2s !important;
}

.workbook-content button:hover, 
.workbook-content .link-item:hover {
    background-color: #00ff00 !important;
    color: #000000 !important;
    box-shadow: 0 0 10px #00ff00, 0 0 20px #00ff00;
}

/* Tabs */
.workbook-content .tab-item {
    background-color: #000000 !important;
    color: #00ff00 !important;
    border: 1px solid #00ff00 !important;
}

.workbook-content .tab-item.active {
    background-color: #001a00 !important;
    box-shadow: 0 0 10px #00ff00;
}

/* Code blocks and console */
.workbook-content pre, 
.workbook-content code {
    background-color: #000000 !important;
    color: #00ff00 !important;
    border: 1px solid #00ff00 !important;
    font-family: 'Courier New', monospace !important;
}

/* Interactive console specific styling */
.workbook-content .console-output {
    background-color: #000000 !important;
    color: #00ff00 !important;
    border: 2px solid #00ff00 !important;
    padding: 10px !important;
    font-family: 'Courier New', monospace !important;
    min-height: 400px !important;
    box-shadow: inset 0 0 20px #001100;
}

/* CRT scanline effect */
.workbook-content::before {
    content: " ";
    display: block;
    position: fixed;
    top: 0;
    left: 0;
    bottom: 0;
    right: 0;
    background: linear-gradient(rgba(18, 16, 16, 0) 50%, rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.25) 50%), linear-gradient(90deg, rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.06), rgba(0, 255, 0, 0.02), rgba(0, 0, 255, 0.06));
    z-index: 2;
    background-size: 100% 2px, 3px 100%;
    pointer-events: none;
}

/* Terminal prompt cursor */
.workbook-content .console-prompt::after {
    content: "▋";
    animation: blink 1s infinite;
    color: #00ff00;
}

@keyframes blink {
    0%, 49% { opacity: 1; }
    50%, 100% { opacity: 0; }
}

/* Success indicators */
.workbook-content .status-success {
    color: #00ff00 !important;
    text-shadow: 0 0 5px #00ff00;
}

/* Warning indicators */
.workbook-content .status-warning {
    color: #ffff00 !important;
    text-shadow: 0 0 5px #ffff00;
}

/* Error indicators */
.workbook-content .status-error {
    color: #ff0000 !important;
    text-shadow: 0 0 5px #ff0000;
}

/* Glow effect for important elements */
.workbook-content .highlight {
    box-shadow: 0 0 10px #00ff00, 0 0 20px #00ff00, 0 0 30px #00ff00;
}
</style>

# 🖥️ DefenderC2 Command & Control Console

> **Enterprise-grade automation and orchestration for Microsoft Defender for Endpoint**  
> *Port of @msdirtbag/MDEAutomator with retro terminal aesthetic*

---

## 🎨 Retro Terminal Theme

This workbook features a **retro green phosphor CRT terminal theme** inspired by classic command-line interfaces.

## ⚡ Quick Start Configuration

Select your **DefenderC2 Function App** and **Workspace** - everything else autodiscovers!

### What's Autodiscovered:
- ✅ **Subscription ID** (from Function App resource)
- ✅ **Resource Group** (from Function App resource)  
- ✅ **Function App Name** (from Function App resource)
- ✅ **Azure AD Tenant ID** (from Function App resource - this is where your App Registration lives!)
- ✅ **API Authentication** (anonymous function endpoint - no key required)

### You Only Select:
1. 🎯 Your DefenderC2 Function App (one click)
2. 📊 Your Log Analytics Workspace (one click)

---

## 📋 Tabs Overview

| Tab | Function | Description |
|-----|----------|-------------|
| **🎯 Defender C2** | Device Actions | Isolate, scan, restrict devices |
| **🛡️ Threat Intel Manager** | Indicators | Manage file/network/certificate indicators |
| **📋 Action Manager** | Action Tracking | View and manage device actions |
| **🔍 Hunt Manager** | Advanced Hunting | Execute KQL hunting queries |
| **🚨 Incident Manager** | Incident Response | Manage security incidents |
| **⚙️ Custom Detection Manager** | Detection Rules | Manage custom detection rules |
| **🖥️ Interactive Console** | Live Response | Shell-like command interface with async execution |

---

parameters.name: FunctionApp
parameters.label: DefenderC2 Function App
parameters.query:
Resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.web/sites'
| where kind contains 'functionapp'
| project id, name, resourceGroup, subscriptionId, location, tags
| order by name asc
parameters.description: Select your DefenderC2 Function App from the list of available Function Apps in your subscription(s).

parameters.name: Workspace
parameters.label: Log Analytics Workspace
parameters.query:
Resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces'
| project id, name, resourceGroup, location
| order by name asc
parameters.description: Select your Log Analytics Workspace (for Sentinel data and dashboards).

parameters.name: Subscription
parameters.label: Subscription (Auto)
parameters.query:
Resources
| where id == '{FunctionApp}'
| project value = subscriptionId
parameters.description: Auto-discovered from selected Function App

parameters.name: ResourceGroup
parameters.label: Resource Group (Auto)
parameters.query:
Resources
| where id == '{FunctionApp}'
| project value = resourceGroup
parameters.description: Auto-discovered from selected Function App

parameters.name: FunctionAppName
parameters.label: Function App Name (Auto)
parameters.query:
Resources
| where id == '{FunctionApp}'
| project value = name
parameters.description: Auto-discovered from selected Function App

parameters.name: TenantId
parameters.label: Microsoft Defender XDR Tenant ID
parameters.query:
ResourceContainers
| where type == 'microsoft.resources/subscriptions'
| project tenantId
| distinct tenantId
| project value = tenantId, label = strcat('🏢 Tenant: ', tenantId)
| order by label asc
parameters.description: Select your Microsoft Defender XDR Tenant ID from available tenants (Azure Lighthouse delegations). Shows all accessible tenant IDs.

parameters.name: DeviceList
parameters.label: Available Devices
parameters.description: ✅ Auto-populated from your Defender environment. Select devices for actions across all tabs.

content.json:
## Defender C2 - Device Response Actions

Perform Microsoft Defender for Endpoint response actions with **ARM Actions** and **JSONPath parsing**.

### Features:
- ✅ Azure Resource Graph auto-discovery
- ✅ ARM Actions for synchronous operations
- ✅ JSONPath output parsing
- ✅ Multi-tenancy support with automatic TenantId injection
- ✅ Anonymous function authentication (no keys needed)

---
## 🚨 Isolate Device

Isolate devices from the network using ARM Actions with JSONPath transformers.

---
## 🔓 Unisolate Device

Remove network isolation from devices.

---
## 🛡️ Restrict App Execution

Restrict app execution to Microsoft-signed binaries only.

---
## 🔍 Run Antivirus Scan

Execute a full antivirus scan on devices.

---
## 💻 Get Devices

Retrieve device list with JSONPath parsing.

## 📍 Threat Intelligence Manager

Manage threat indicators (IOCs) in Microsoft Defender for Endpoint with **ARM Actions** and **JSONPath parsing**.

### Features:
- ✅ Batch indicator submission (File/IP/URL/Domain)
- ✅ ARM Actions for synchronous operations
- ✅ JSONPath output parsing
- ✅ Multi-tenancy support

---
## 📄 Add File Indicators (Batch)

Submit multiple file hashes at once with ARM Actions.

parameters.name: FileIndicators
parameters.label: File Hashes (comma-separated)
parameters.description: SHA1, SHA256, or MD5 hashes separated by commas

parameters.name: FileTitle
parameters.label: Title
parameters.description: Title for these indicators

parameters.name: FileDescription
parameters.label: Description
parameters.description: Description for these indicators

content.json:
---
## 🌐 Add IP Indicators (Batch)

Submit multiple IP addresses at once.

parameters.name: IpIndicators
parameters.label: IP Addresses (comma-separated)
parameters.description: IPv4 or IPv6 addresses separated by commas

content.json:
---
## 🔗 Add URL/Domain Indicators (Batch)

Submit multiple URLs or domains at once.

parameters.name: UrlIndicators
parameters.label: URLs/Domains (comma-separated)
parameters.description: URLs or domain names separated by commas

content.json:
---
## 📊 List All Indicators

View all threat indicators with JSONPath parsing.

## ⚙️ Action Manager

View and manage machine actions with **auto-refresh** and **JSONPath parsing**.

### Features:
- ✅ Auto-refresh with configurable intervals
- ✅ JSONPath output parsing
- ✅ Status filtering
- ✅ Cancel actions via ARM Actions

---
## 📊 Get All Actions

View all machine actions with auto-refresh enabled.

---
## 🔍 Get Action Status

Retrieve status of a specific action.

parameters.name: ActionId
parameters.label: Action ID
parameters.description: Enter specific action ID to query

content.json:
---
## 🛑 Cancel Action

Cancel a specific pending action.

## 🔍 Hunt Manager

Execute advanced hunting queries with **async polling** and **JSONPath parsing**.

### Features:
- ✅ Async hunt execution with auto-refresh
- ✅ JSONPath result parsing
- ✅ Sample query templates
- ✅ Export to Excel capability

---
## 📝 Sample Queries

Select a sample query or enter your own KQL.

parameters.name: SampleQuery
parameters.label: Sample Queries
parameters.jsonData: [{"value":"DeviceEvents | where Timestamp > ago(24h) | where ActionType == 'ProcessCreated' | take 100","label":"Recent Process Creations"},{"value":"AlertInfo | where Timestamp > ago(7d) | where Severity == 'High' | project Timestamp, Title, Severity, Category","label":"High Severity Alerts"},{"value":"DeviceNetworkEvents | where Timestamp > ago(1d) | where RemoteIPType == 'Public' | summarize Count=count() by RemoteIP, DeviceName","label":"Public Network Connections"},{"value":"DeviceFileEvents | where Timestamp > ago(1d) | where FileName endswith '.exe' | project Timestamp, DeviceName, FileName, FolderPath","label":"Recent EXE Files"},{"value":"DeviceLogonEvents | where Timestamp > ago(1d) | where ActionType == 'LogonFailed' | summarize FailedAttempts=count() by DeviceName, AccountName","label":"Failed Logon Attempts"}]

parameters.name: HuntQuery
parameters.label: KQL Query (or use sample above)
parameters.description: Enter your KQL query or select from samples

content.json:
---
## 🎯 Execute Hunt

Run your hunt query with automatic result polling.

---
## 📊 Hunt Status

Monitor the status of your hunt query execution.

## 🚨 Incident Manager

Manage security incidents with **filters** and **JSONPath parsing**.

### Features:
- ✅ Severity and status filtering
- ✅ JSONPath output parsing
- ✅ Update incidents via ARM Actions
- ✅ Add comments to incidents

---
## 📊 Get Incidents

View incidents with filtering options.

---
## ✏️ Update Incident

Update incident status or assignment.

---
## 💬 Add Comment to Incident

Add a comment to an existing incident.

## 🛡️ Custom Detection Manager

Manage custom detection rules with **ARM Actions** and **JSONPath parsing**.

### Features:
- ✅ List all detections with JSONPath
- ✅ Create/Update/Delete via ARM Actions
- ✅ Backup detections for migration
- ✅ Sample detection templates

---
## 📋 List All Detections

View all custom detection rules with JSONPath parsing.

---
## ➕ Create Detection Rule

Create a new custom detection rule.

---
## ✏️ Update Detection Rule

Modify an existing detection rule.

---
## ❌ Delete Detection Rule

Remove a custom detection rule.

---
## 💾 Backup Detections

Export all detection rules for backup or migration.

## 🖥️ Interactive Console - Live Response Command Execution ### 🎯 Shell-Like Interface with Async Execution
``` ╔══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╗ ║ DefenderC2 Interactive Live Response Shell ║ ║ Port of @msdirtbag/MDEAutomator ║ ╚══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╝ SYSTEM STATUS: OPERATIONAL CONNECTION: ACTIVE AUTH: MULTI-TENANT APP REGISTRATION MODE: ASYNC EXECUTION WITH AUTO-POLLING ╭─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╮ │ FEATURES │ ├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤ │ ✅ Async Command Execution │ Commands run in background via Function │ │ ✅ Auto-Polling Results │ Automatic status checking (configurable) │ │ ✅ JSON Response Parsing │ Structured output display │ │ ✅ Multi-Action Support │ Device actions, queries, API calls │ │ ✅ Execution History Tracking │ Command audit trail │ │ ✅ Library File Operations │ Upload, deploy, download files │ ╰─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╯ ╭─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╮ │ AVAILABLE COMMAND TYPES │ ├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤ │ 🎯 DefenderC2Dispatcher │ Device actions (Isolate, Scan, Restrict) │ │ 🔍 DefenderC2HuntManager │ Advanced Hunting (KQL queries) │ │ 🛡️ DefenderC2TIManager │ Threat Intelligence (Indicators) │ │ 🚨 DefenderC2IncidentManager│ Incident Management (Update, Comment) │ │ ⚙️ DefenderC2CDManager │ Custom Detection Rules │ │ 🎻 DefenderC2Orchestrator │ Live Response & Library Operations │ ╰─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╯ ```
### 📋 Step-by-Step Execution Execute commands and track results through the following workflow: ---

parameters.name: RefreshInterval
parameters.label: Auto Refresh Interval
parameters.jsonData: [{"value":"10000","label":"🟢 10 seconds"},{"value":"30000","label":"🟢 30 seconds"},{"value":"60000","label":"🟡 1 minute"},{"value":"300000","label":"🔵 5 minutes"},{"value":"0","label":"🔴 Manual Only"}]

parameters.name: CommandType
parameters.label: Command Type
parameters.jsonData: [{"value": "dispatcher", "label": "\ud83c\udfaf Device Actions (Isolate, Scan, etc.)"}, {"value": "hunt", "label": "\ud83d\udd0d Advanced Hunting Query"}, {"value": "ti", "label": "\ud83d\udccd Threat Intelligence"}, {"value": "incident", "label": "\ud83d\udea8 Incident Management"}, {"value": "detection", "label": "\ud83d\udee1\ufe0f Custom Detection"}, "\ud83d\udcda List Library Files", "\ud83d\udce4 Upload to Library", "\ud83d\udce5 Get Library File", "\ud83d\ude80 Deploy from Library"]
parameters.description: Select command type: Device actions, Live Response commands, or Library management

parameters.name: ActionName
parameters.label: Action/Command
parameters.jsonData: [{"value":"isolate","label":"Isolate Device"},{"value":"unisolate","label":"Unisolate Device"},{"value":"scan","label":"Run Antivirus Scan"},{"value":"collect","label":"Collect Investigation Package"},{"value":"restrict","label":"Restrict App Execution"},{"value":"unrestrict","label":"Unrestrict App Execution"},{"value":"stopandquarantine","label":"Stop & Quarantine File"},{"value":"runscript","label":"Run Live Response Script"},{"value":"getfile","label":"Get File (Live Response)"},{"value":"putfile","label":"Put File (Live Response)"}]

parameters.name: DeviceIds
parameters.label: Target Device IDs (comma-separated)
parameters.description: Enter one or more device IDs separated by commas

parameters.name: CommandParams
parameters.label: Additional Parameters (JSON)
parameters.description: Optional JSON parameters for the command

parameters.name: LibraryFileNameUpload
parameters.label: 📤 Library File Name (Upload)
parameters.description: Name for the file in library (e.g., investigation.ps1)

parameters.name: LibraryContentUpload
parameters.label: 📤 File Content (Base64 encoded)
parameters.description: Base64-encoded file content to upload to library

parameters.name: LibraryFileNameGet
parameters.label: 📥 Library File Name (Get)
parameters.description: Name of file to retrieve from library

parameters.name: LibraryDeployFileName
parameters.label: 🚀 Library File Name (Deploy)
parameters.description: Name of file from library to deploy to device(s)

content.json:
---
### 🚀 Step 1: Execute Command

Click the button below to execute the selected command. The Function App will process the request asynchronously.

---
### ⏳ Step 2: Poll for Results

Automatically polls for command completion. Refresh interval: **{RefreshInterval}ms**

content.title: 📊 Action Status (Auto-refresh)
content.noDataMessage: No active actions to poll. Execute a command first.

content.json:
---
### 📥 Step 3: View Results

Parsed JSON results from the command execution.

content.title: 📋 Command Results
content.noDataMessage: No results available yet. Command may still be executing.

content.json:
---
### 📚 Command History

Recent command executions and their status.

---
### 🔄 How It Works

**Architecture:**
1. **Execute** → Sends command to Function App with parameters
2. **Function App** → Authenticates with MDE API using managed identity
3. **Poll** → Automatically checks action status at configured interval
4. **Parse** → Extracts and displays JSON results in table format
5. **History** → Tracks all executions for audit and review

**Key Features:**
- ✅ Async execution - commands run in background
- ✅ Auto-polling - no manual status checking needed
- ✅ JSON parsing - structured data display
- ✅ Multi-tenant - works across different tenants
- ✅ Audit trail - complete execution history

**Supported Commands:**
- Device actions (isolate, scan, collect packages)
- Live Response operations (run scripts, get/put files)
- Advanced Hunting queries
- Threat Intelligence management
- Incident and detection operations

---

> 💡 **Tip:** Set auto-refresh to 30 seconds for active monitoring, or disable for manual control.
